sen.j: 松室 重光（まつむろ しげみつ、1873年4月26日 - 1937年1月30日）は、京都を中心に多くの建築物の設計を手がけた建築家。
sen.e: Shigemitsu MATSUMURO (April 26, 1973 - January 30, 1937) was an architect who designed many buildings centered around Kyoto.
Shigemitsu MATSUMURO (April 26, 1973 - January 30, 1937) was an architect who designed many buildings centered around Kyoto.
Shigemitsu MATSUMURO (April 26, 1973 - January 30, 1937) was an architect who designed many buildings centered around Kyoto.

sen.j: ネオ・ルネサンス様式の名建築として知られる京都府庁舎旧本館や、京都ハリストス正教会聖堂などの設計などで知られる。
sen.e: He is known as the designer of the former main hall of the Kyoto Prefectural Office Building, which is known an excellent building in the neo-Renaissance style and that of the sacred building of Kyoto Orthodox Church.

He is known as the designer of the former main hall of the Kyoto Prefectural Office Building, which is known an excellent building in the neo-Renaissance style and that of the sacred building of Kyoto Orthodox Church.

sen.j: 1873年（明治6年）京都府愛宕郡下鴨村（現・京都市）に生まれる
sen.e: 1873: He was born in Shimogamo Village, Atago County, Kyoto Prefecture (in present Kyoto City).
1873: He was born in Shimogamo Village, Atago County, Kyoto Prefecture (in present Kyoto City).

sen.j: 1894年（明治27年）第三高等中学校を経て、東京帝国大学造家学科に入学
sen.e: 1894: He entered the architecture department of Tokyo Imperial University after graduating Third Advanced Grade Junior High School.
1894: He entered the architecture department of Tokyo Imperial University after graduating Third Advanced Grade Junior High School.

sen.e: !897: He graduated the architecture department of Tokyo Imperial University.

sen.j: 大学院に進学し、在籍のまま京都市の嘱託技師となる
sen.e: He advanced to its graduate school and was entrusted with a temporary engineer post in Kyoto City, while retaining the student status.
He advanced to its graduate school and was entrusted with a temporary engineer post in Kyoto City, while retaining the student status.

sen.e: !898: He took an engineer post at the Kyoto Prefectural government.

sen.j: 1904年（明治37年）京都府を退職
sen.e: 1904: He resigned his post at the Kyoto Prefectural government.

sen.j: 1905年（明治38年）九州鉄道株式会社技師となる
sen.e: 1905: He took an engineer post at Kyushu Railway Corporation.

sen.j: 1908年（明治41年）関東都督府技師となる
sen.e: 1908: Ht took an engineer post at Kantototokufu (Japan's Guandong Governor-General Office).
1908: Ht took an engineer post at Kantototokufu (Japan's Guandong Governor-General Office).

sen.j: 1923年（大正12年）関東都督府を依願退職、大阪電気博覧会嘱託となる
sen.e: 1923: He resigned his engineer post at Kantototokufu voluntarily and took a temporary position at Osaka Electric Exhibition.
1923: He resigned his engineer post at Kantototokufu voluntarily and took a temporary position at Osaka Electric Exhibition.

sen.e: 1927: He entered the Kataoka architecture office.
